radiographic_examinations.findings: Histology was consistent with a diagnosis of Chronic Telogen Effluvium (CTE).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The ratio of terminal to vellus hairs (T:V) was consistent with CTE; no miniaturization was observed.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A repeated scalp biopsy specimen showed 32 follicles on horizontal section, of which none were miniaturized.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Hair shedding continued; the second biopsy maintained consistency with CTE.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Standardized scalp photography showed no discernible reduction in hair density over the midfrontal or vertex scalp.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Hair shedding continued; however, no loss of hair density was observed over time.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Three 4-mm punch biopsy specimens revealed T:V ratios consistent with CTE.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Continuing hair shedding; maintained diagnosis of CTE.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Photos showed no loss of hair volume and no biopsy was performed.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite continued hair shedding, hair density remained unchanged.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Repeated biopsy specimens showed no evidence of FPHL almost 10 years after initial presentation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Hair shedding continued, but hair density remained unchanged, with no significant changes noted.
